revised_title: Photoelectron Spectroscopy of Iron-Carbon Monoxide Surface
tldr: The authors conducted photoelectron spectroscopy experiments on the α-Fe(111)-carbon monoxide surface at 300 K. They found a mixed chemisorption regime where carbon monoxide dissociates and forms a 'carbide-oxide' layer at low coverage, followed by associative molecular binding at higher coverages. Preadsorption of dihydrogen reduces the extent of dissociation of subsequently sorbed carbon monoxide.
